      • hasToken

        public boolean hasToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: OAuthTokenResolver
        Returns true if the specified request has an associated user OAuth Token, false otherwise. Often used as a guard/check before executing OAuthTokenResolver.getRequiredToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest).
        Specified by:
        hasToken in interface OAuthTokenResolver
        Parameters:
        request - the current servlet request.
        Returns:
        true if the specified request has an associated user OAuth Token, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        OAuthTokenResolver.getRequiredToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest)

      • getToken

        public String getToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: OAuthTokenResolver
        Returns the current user OAuth Token (access or refresh) associated with the specified request or null if no token is associated with the request.

        In security-sensitive workflows, it might be better to use OAuthTokenResolver.getRequiredToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest) to help eliminate NullPointerExceptions and conditional branching bugs.

        Specified by:
        getToken in interface OAuthTokenResolver
        Parameters:
        request - the current servlet request.
        Returns:
        the current user OAuth Token (access or refresh) associated with the specified request or null if no OAuth Token is associated with the request.
        See Also:
        OAuthTokenResolver.hasToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest), OAuthTokenResolver.getRequiredToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest)

      • getRequiredToken

        public String getRequiredToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: OAuthTokenResolver
        Returns the current user OAuth Token (access or refresh) associated with the request or throws an IllegalArgumentException exception if there is no account associated with the request.

        Often this method will be used within a conditional, first checking that OAuthTokenResolver.hasToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest) returns true, for example:

             if (AccessTokenResolver.INSTANCE.hasToken(servletRequest)) {
         AccessToken accessToken = AccessTokenResolver.INSTANCE.getRequiredToken(servletRequest);
         //do something with the account
     }
        This check-then-use pattern helps eliminate NullPointerExceptions and conditional branching bugs when working with user identities - often desirable in sensitive logic.
        Specified by:
        getRequiredToken in interface OAuthTokenResolver
        Parameters:
        request - the current servlet request.
        Returns:
        the current user OAuth Token associated with the request
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
